sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following bipartite graph. It represents seven students and six courses that they could take. Find a perfect matching in this graph if each student can only take one course.
 
```
     +--------+
   / |        | \
S1  S2       S3  S4
   \ |        | /
     +--------+
      /      \
     C1      C2
     |        |
     C3      C4
     |        |
     C5      C6
```
message_2: Since there are seven students and only six courses, it is not possible to find a perfect matching in this bipartite graph where each student can only take one course. A perfect matching would require an equal number of students and courses, with each student taking exactly one course and each course being taken by exactly one student.
